questions.question: It ………………….. not cost much.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts. It is singular subject. Hence we use does here.

questions.question: ……………………… forget to bring the book.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences.

questions.question: ………………………… the door when you leave.
questions.description: The subject of an imperative sentence is always you hence we use the plural verb close here.

questions.question: She ……………………………. faster than anybody I know.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: He was a true soldier who ………………………….. devoted to the country.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: I …………………………… for a walk every morning.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about our habits and routines.

questions.question: We ………………………. to Chennai last month.
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: We …………………………… to watch a football match yesterday
Heavy rains ……………………….. the city last week.
I …………………………. him only once.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about life experiences up to now.

questions.question: Has anyone ……………………… my purse?
questions.description: We use the third form of the verb after has/have/had.
